qas.question: What Samoan author write Flying Fox in Freedom Tree?
In what country was Flying Fox in Freedom Tree made into a feature film?
Which Wendt novel was made into a film directed by Paul Maunder?
Who won a Commonwealth Writers' Prize for fiction for her book "Where We Once Belonged"?
What type of literature does Tusiata Avia write?

plausible_answers.text: Flying Fox in a Freedom Tree

qas.question: What novel was written by Martyn Sanderson?

plausible_answers.text: was made into a feature film in New Zealand

qas.question: What happened to Martyn Sanderson's novel in 1989?
What did Paul Maunder win in 1997?
What novel was written by Paul Maunder?
What book of poetry was published by John Kneubuhl in 2004?

context: <a0_0>Albert Wendt<a0_0/> is a significant Samoan writer whose novels and stories tell the Samoan experience. In 1989, his novel <b5_0>Flying Fox in a Freedom Tree<b5_0/> <b6_0>was made into a feature film in <a1_0>New Zealand<b6_0/><a1_0/>, directed by Martyn Sanderson. Another novel <a2_0>Sons for the Return Home<a2_0/> had also been made into a feature film in 1979, directed by Paul Maunder. The late John Kneubuhl, born in American Samoa, was an accomplished playwright and screenwriter and writer. <a3_0>Sia Figiel<a3_0/> won the 1997 <b7_0>Commonwealth Writers' Prize for fiction<b7_0/> in the south-east Asia/South Pacific region with her novel <b8_0>"Where We Once Belonged"<b8_0/>. Momoe Von Reiche is an internationally recognised poet and artist. Tusiata Avia is a performance poet. Her first book of <a4_0>poetry<a4_0/> <b9_0>Wild Dogs Under My Skirt<b9_0/> was published by Victoria University Press in 2004. Dan Taulapapa McMullin is an artist and writer. Other Samoan poets and writers include Sapa'u Ruperake Petaia, Eti Sa'aga and Savea Sano Malifa, the editor of the Samoa Observer.
